intro: Icacorea utleyi, commonly known as the Texas coralbean, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain seeds covered in a silky coating. Icacorea utleyi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun.
